get.description: Get a release with id `release_id`. if `release_id` is `latest`, return the latest release that was distributed to the current user (from all the distribution groups).

parameters.description: The secret of the target application

parameters.name: release_id
parameters.description: The ID of the release, or `latest` to get the latest release from all the distribution groups assigned to the current user.

400.description: bad_request: `release_id` is not a number or the string `latest`.

404.description: not_found - A release or an app can't be found.

get.description: Get a release with id `release_id`. if `release_id` is `latest`, return the latest release that was distributed to the current user (from all the distribution groups).

parameters.name: release_id
parameters.description: The ID of the release, or `latest` to get the latest release from all the distribution groups assigned to the current user.

400.description: bad_request: `release_id` is not a number or the string `latest`.

404.description: not_found - A release or an app can't be found.

parameters.name: release_id
parameters.description: The ID of the release

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The release information.

400.description: not_supported: Trying to change a distribution group. Currently this operation is not supported.

parameters.name: release_id
parameters.description: The ID of the release

404.description: not_found: An app or a release couldn't be found

500.description:
An internal error. Delete can partially fail. If that happens partially_deleted error_code is returned.
partially_deleted: Release was removed from all distribution groups, but couldn't be deleted from Mobile Center.

get.description: Return detailed information about releases.

parameters.name: published_only
parameters.description: when true, filters out releases that were uplaoded but were never distributed. Releases that under deleted distribution groups will not be filtered out.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: OBSOLETE. Will be removed in next version. An OData style filter. Currently only support the 'eq' comparision type. E.g. ?$filter=status eq 'Available'

Return detailed information about a distributed release in a given distribution group.

parameters.name: distribution_group_name
parameters.description: The name of the distribution group.

parameters.name: release_id
parameters.description: Must be `latest`, a specific `release_id` is not supported at this time.

404.description:
1. error code - not_found - Distribution group or the app doesn't exist.
2. error code - no_releases_for_app - App has no releases.

2. error code - not_found - Not found.

upload_id.description: A unique ID of the upload

version.description:
The release's version.
For iOS: CFBundleVersion from info.plist.
For Android: android:versionCode from AppManifest.xml.

short_version.description:
The release's short version.
For iOS: CFBundleShortVersionString from info.plist.
For Android: android:versionName from AppManifest.xml.

uploaded_at.description: UTC time in ISO 8601 format of the uploaded time.

distribution_groups.description: a list of distribution groups that are associated with this release.

status.description:
OBSOLETE. Will be removed in next version. The availability concept is now replaced with distributed. Any 'available' release will be associated with the default distribution group of an app.
The release state.
available: The uploaded release has been distributed.
unavailable: The uploaded release is not visible to the user.

app_name.description: The app's name (extracted from the uploaded release).

version.description:
The release's version.
For iOS: CFBundleVersion from info.plist. For Android: android:versionCode from AppManifest.xml.

short_version.description:
The release's short version.
For iOS: CFBundleShortVersionString from info.plist. For Android: android:versionName from AppManifest.xml.

min_os.description: The release's minimum required operating system.

android_min_api_level.description: The release's minimum required Android API level.

fingerprint.description: MD5 checksum of the release binary.

uploaded_at.description: UTC time in ISO 8601 format of the uploaded time.

download_url.description: The URL that hosts the binary for this release.

app_icon_url.description: A URL to the app's icon.

install_url.description: The href required to install a release on a mobile device. On iOS devices will be prefixed with `itms-services://?action=download-manifest&url=`

distribution_groups.description: a list of distribution groups that are associated with this release.

ReleaseUploadBeginResponse.description: A response containing information pertaining to starting a release upload process

upload_id.description: The ID for the current upload

upload_url.description: The URL where the client needs to upload the release to

ReleaseUploadEndRequest.description: A request containing information pertaining to complete a release upload process

status.description: The desired operation for the upload

ReleaseUploadEndResponse.description: A response containing information about the uploaded release.

release_url.description: A URL to the new release. If upload was aborted will be null.

ReleaseUpdateRequest.description: A request containing information for updating a release.

distribution_group_name.description: Name of a distribution group. The release will be associated with this distribution group. If the distribution group doesn't exist a 400 is returned. If both distribution group name and id are passed, the id is taking precedence.

distribution_group_id.description: Id of a distribution group. The release will be associated with this distribution group. If the distribution group doesn't exist a 400 is returned. If both distribution group name and id are passed, the id is taking precedence.

PackageUploadBeginResponse.description: A response containing information pertaining to starting a package upload process

upload_id.description: The ID for the current upload

upload_url.description: The URL where the client needs to upload the package to

PackageUploadEndRequest.description: A request containing information pertaining to completing a package upload process

status.description: The desired operation for the upload

PackageUploadEndResponse.description: A response containing information about the uploaded package.

package_url.description: A URL to the new package. If upload was aborted will be null.

PackageUpdateRequest.description: A request containing information for updating a package.

distribution_group_name.description: Name of a distribution group. The package will be associated with this distribution group. If the distribution group doesn't exist a 400 is returned. If both distribution group name and id are passed, the id is taking precedence.

distribution_group_id.description: Id of a distribution group. The package will be associated with this distribution group. If the distribution group doesn't exist a 400 is returned. If both distribution group name and id are passed, the id is taking precedence.

id.description: ID identifying a unique distribution group.

name.description: A name identifying a unique distribution group.

is_latest.description: Is the containing release the latest one in this distribution group.

The package's version.
For iOS: CFBundleVersion from info.plist.
For Android: android:versionCode from AppManifest.xml.

short_version.description:
The package's short version.
For iOS: CFBundleShortVersionString from info.plist.
For Android: android:versionName from AppManifest.xml.

uploaded_at.description: UTC time in ISO 8601 format of the uploaded time.

distribution_groups.description: a list of distribution groups that are associated with this package.

status.description:
OBSOLETE. Will be removed in next version. The availability concept is now replaced with distributed. Any 'available' package will be associated with the default distribution group of an app.

client_callback.description: The callback URL that the client can optionally provide to get status updates for the current symbol upload

SymbolUploadBeginResponse.description: A response containing information pertaining to starting a symbol upload process

symbol_upload_id.description: The id for the current upload

upload_url.description: The URL where the client needs to upload the symbol blob to

expiration_date.description: Describes how long the upload_url is valid

SymbolUploadEndRequest.description: A request containing information pertaining to completing a symbol upload process

status.description: The desired operation for the symbol upload

platform.description: SDK/Platform this thread is beeing generated from

Stacktrace.description: a stacktrace in a processed and prettyfied way

exception.description: potential additional exception happened in that thread (Last Exception Backtrace)

relevant.description: Shows if a thread is relevant or not. Is false if all frames are non relevant, otherwise true

platform.description: SDK/Platform this thread is beeing generated from

StackFrame.description: a single frame of a stack trace

app_code.description: this line isn't from any framework

ReasonStackFrame.description: frame belonging to the reason of the crash

app_code.description: this line isn't from any framework

name.description: symbol name

crash_count.description: number of crashes that belong to this group

last_modified.description: last update date for the group

MissingSymbolCrashGroups.description: A list of crash groups formed by missing symbols combination

MissingSymbolCrashGroupsResponse.description: grouped by missing symbols crashes response object

total_crash_count.description: total number of cashes for all the groups

crashes.description: the total crash count for day

daily.description: the active device count for each interval

weekly.description: the active device count for each interval with a week's retention

monthly.description: the active device count for each interval with a month's retention

Places.description: Places and count during the time range in descending order

Place.description: The place code and the count

count.description: the count of the this place

previous_count.description: the count of previous time range of the place

code.description: The status code return by the API. It can be 400 or 403 or 500.

message.description: The reason for the request failed

distribution.description: the count of sessions in these buckets

count.description: the count of sessions in current bucket

previous_average_duration.description: the previous average session duration for previous time range

average_duration.description: the average session duration for current time range

previous_count.description: the count of previous time range of the version

sessions.description: the total session count for each interval

sessions_per_user.description: the session count for each interval per device

total_count.description: The full number of versions accross all pages.

CrashesOverall.description: list of crash groups with overall crashes count and affected users

total_devices.description: the active device over this period

previous_device_count.description: the device count of previous time range of the event

previous_count.description: the event count of previous time range of the event

exceeded_max_limit.description: indicates if the number of available logs are more than the max allowed return limit(100).

last_received_log_timestamp.description: the timestamp of the last log received. This value can be used as the start time parameter in the consecutive API call.

sdk_name.description: Name of the SDK. Consists of the name of the SDK and the platform, e.g. "avalanchesdk.ios", "hockeysdk.android".

sdk_version.description: Version of the SDK in semver format, e.g. "1.2.0" or "0.12.3-alpha.1".

wrapper_sdk_version.description: Version of the wrapper SDK in semver format. When the SDK is embedding another base SDK (for example Xamarin.Android wraps Android), the Xamarin specific version is populated into this field while sdkVersion refers to the original Android SDK.

wrapper_sdk_name.description: Name of the wrapper SDK. Consists of the name of the SDK and the wrapper platform, e.g. "avalanchesdk.xamarin", "hockeysdk.cordova".

os_name.description: OS name (example: iOS). The following OS names are standardized (non-exclusive): Android, iOS, macOS, tvOS, Windows.

os_api_level.description: API level when applicable like in Android (example: 15).

time_zone_offset.description: The offset in minutes from UTC for the device time zone, including daylight savings time.

screen_size.description: Screen size of the device in pixels (example: 640x480).

app_namespace.description: The bundle identifier, package identifier, or namespace, depending on what the individual plattforms use,  .e.g com.microsoft.example.

EventProperties.description: Event properties during the time range

EventPropertyValues.description: Event property value counts during the time range in descending order

EventPropertyValue.description: An event property value with counts

name.description: The event property value name

count.description: The count of the the event property value

previous_count.description: The count of previous time range of the event property value

pns_send_failure.description: Number of the notifications failed to send to the push provider.

pns_send_success.description: Number of the notifications successfully sent to push the provider.

name.description: Notification name
The name of the device model and OS version

id.description: The unique id of the device configuration

TestRun.title: Test Run
TestRun.description: Summary single test run on Xamarin Test Cloud

id.description: The unique id of the test upload

date.description: The date and time the test was uploaded

appVersion.description: The compiled version of the app binary

testSeries.description: The name of the test series with which this test upload is associated

platform.description: The device platform targeted by the test. Possible values are 'ios' or 'android'

runStatus.description: The current status of the test run, in relation to the various phases

description.description: Human readable explanation of the current test status

testType.description: The name of the test framework used to run this test

uploadedBy.description: The name of the user who uploaded the test

TestRunStatistics.title: Test Run Statistics
TestRunStatistics.description: Summary single test run on Xamarin Test Cloud

devices.description: Number of devices running the test

peakMemory.description: The max amount of MB used during the test run

totalDeviceMinutes.description: The number of minutes of device time the test has been runnign

TestSeries.title: Test Series
TestSeries.description: Summary of a single test series

slug.description: Unique, human-readable identifier of the test series

name.description: Name of the test series

mostRecentActivity.description: Date of the latest test run that used this test series

TestRunSummary.title: Test Run Summary
TestRunSummary.description: Most important information about a test run.

statusDescription.description: Human-readable status of the test run.

completed.description: Tells whether the test run has completed

DeviceSelection.title: Device Selection
DeviceSelection.description: Short ID for a list of device IDs

endsAt.description: The date the subscription will end or ended

daysLeft.description: The number of days left in the subscription

name.description: The name of the tier

message.description: Human-readable message that describes the error

TestCloudFileHashDeprecated.title: Test Cloud File Hash
TestCloudFileHashDeprecated.description: Hash, type, path and byte range of a file that is required in test run

byte_range.description: Range of bytes required to verify ownership of the file

TestCloudFileHash.title: Test Cloud File Hash
TestCloudFileHash.description: Hash, type, path and byte range of a file that is required in test run

TestCloudFileHashResponse.title: Test Cloud File Hash Response
TestCloudFileHashResponse.description: Response message for single uploaded file hash

TestCloudHashUploadStatus.title: Test Cloud Hash Upload Status
TestCloudHashUploadStatus.description: Result of uploading a single file hash

statusCode.description: HTTP status code that represent result of upload

location.description: URI that should be used to make POST request if file with given hash doesn't exist. This is set when status_code is equal to 412

TestCloudStartTestRunOptions.title: Test Cloud Start Test Run Options
TestCloudStartTestRunOptions.description: Options required to start the test run

language.description: Language that should be used to run tests.

locale.description: Locale that should be used to run tests.

test_parameters.description: A JSON dictionary with additional test parameters

TestCloudStartTestRunResult.title: Test Cloud Test Run Start Result
TestCloudStartTestRunResult.description: Result of starting a test run

accepted_devices.description: List with names of accepted devices

rejected_devices.description: List with names and descriptions of rejected devices

TestRunState.title: Test Run State
TestRunState.description: Current status of a test run

message.description: Multi-line message that describes the status

wait_time.description: Time (in seconds) that the client should wait for before checking the status again

release_method.description: The release method is unknown if unspecified

app_id.name: app_id
app_id.description: The unique ID (UUID) of the app

invitation_token.name: invitation_token
invitation_token.description: The app invitation token that was sent to the user

user_name.name: user_name
user_name.description: The slug name of the user

form.name: form
form.description: The selected form of the object

path_symbol_upload_id.name: symbol_upload_id
path_symbol_upload_id.description: The ID of the symbol upload

path_symbol_id.name: symbol_id
path_symbol_id.description: The ID of the symbol (uuid of the symbol)

last_occurrence_from.name: last_occurrence_from
last_occurrence_from.description: Earliest date when the last time a crash occured in a error group

last_occurrence_to.name: last_occurrence_to
last_occurrence_to.description: Latest date when the last time a crash occured in a error group

include_report.name: include_report
include_report.description: true if the error should include the raw error report. Default is false

include_log.name: include_log
include_log.description: true if the error should include the custom log report. Default is false

group_text_search.name: group_text_search
group_text_search.description: A freetext search that matches in error, error types, error stack_traces and error user

StartParameter.name: start
StartParameter.description: Start date time in data in ISO 8601 date time format

LogFlowStartTimeParameter.name: start
LogFlowStartTimeParameter.description: Start date time in data in ISO 8601 date time format. It must be within the current day in the UTC timezone. The default value is the start time of the current day in UTC timezone.

EndParameter.name: end
EndParameter.description: Last date time in data in ISO 8601 date time format

CrashGroupParameter.name: crash_group_id
CrashGroupParameter.description: The id of the crash group

EventPropertyParameter.name: event_property_name
EventPropertyParameter.description: The id of the event property

IntervalParameter.name: interval
IntervalParameter.description: Size of interval in ISO 8601 duration format. (PnYnMnDTnHnMnS|PnW|P<date>T<time>). The valid durations are 1 day (P1D), 1 week (P1W), and 30 days (P30D).

CountParameter.name: count
CountParameter.description: The number of results to return

TopParameter.name: $top
TopParameter.description: The maximum number of results to return. (0 will fetch all results)

SkipParameter.name: $skip
SkipParameter.description: The offset (starting at 0) of the first result to return. This parameter along with limit is used to perform pagination.

InlineCountParameter.name: $inlinecount
InlineCountParameter.description: Controls whether or not to include a count of all the items accross all pages.

OrderByParameter.name: $orderby
OrderByParameter.description: controls the sorting order and sorting based on which column

PropertyCountParameter.name: count
PropertyCountParameter.description: The number of property values to return
